summary: The Security Council adopted Resolution 2289 (2016) on 27 May 2016, recalling previous resolutions on Somalia. The Council authorized the African Union Member States to maintain the deployment of AMISOM until 8 July 2016, with a maximum level of 22,126 uniformed personnel. The mandate, as set out in resolution 2232 (2015), allows participating Member States to take necessary measures. The Secretary-General will continue to provide logistical support as per resolution 2245 (2015). The Council will remain actively seized of the matter.
